entry.title: Combined summary - Blockchain alternative storage
entry.summary: A user named Marko Otbalkana inquired about any work or projects related to storing the block chain in a database and tools that can read the block chain from the Satoshi client and convert it into different formats on the Bitcoin-development mailing list. To store the best chain, a simple schema can be created using PostgreSQL or MySQL. The schema includes tables for blocks, transaction_inputs, and transaction_outputs with primary keys and size check constraints. In response to Marko's inquiry, BitcoinJ was mentioned as a project that stores parsed blocks in H2, an embedded SQL database for Java. Additionally, Jouke Hofman of Bitonic.nl recommended using a project called bitcoin-abe to store the blockchain in a database. The project is available on GitHub and there is also a discussion thread about it on the bitcointalk.org forum. ServiceNow was advertised as a cloud service that can automate IT design, transition, and operations, offer high-level views of enterprise services through dashboards, and provide a single system of record for all IT processes. The email also included a sponsored message about ServiceNow.
